Interface Encryptable


  • public interface Encryptable
    Protocol for the server / client encryption and decryption programs.
    Version:
    March 31, 2017
    Author:
    G. Monagan

    • Field Detail

      • PORT

        static final int PORT
        port for encryption
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HOST

        static final java.lang.String HOST
        Server's IP address ... super funny that it would be here and that it is not a line argument but your instructor did not get around to covering section 11.3 of the textbook which is on line arguments
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NAME

        static final int NAME
        message sent by the server to the client
        NAME takes one integer argument

        NAME n

        where n is the name (number) of the client.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENCODED

        static final int ENCODED
        response sent by the server to the client
        ENCODED takes one integer argument followed by n characters

        ENCODED n char0 char1 ... charn-1

        where n is the number of characters that will follow after the integer n.
        ENCODED is to be interpreted as a response by the server to the client with the encoded text (based on the plain text that the client had sent) and the encoded text consists of n (encrypted) characters.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PLAIN

        static final int PLAIN
        response sent by the server to the client
        PLAIN takes one integer argument followed by n characters

        PLAIN n char0 char1 ... charn-1

        where n is the number of characters that will follow after the integer n.
        PLAIN is to be interpreted as a response by the server to the client with the plain text (based on the encrypted text that the client had sent) and the plain text consists of n (decrypted) characters.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DONE

        static final int DONE
        response sent by the server to the client
        DONE does not have arguments

        DONE

        DONE means I received the request that the client is quitting so I'm crossing the client off my list of active clients.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENCRYPT

        static final int ENCRYPT
        request sent by the client to the server
        ENCRYPT takes one integer argument followed by n characters

        ENCRYPT n char0 char1 ... charn-1

        where n is the number of characters that will follow after the integer n.
        ENCRYPT is to be interpreted as a request by the client to the server to encrypt the n characters that will follow the integer n.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DECRYPT

        static final int DECRYPT
        request sent by the client to the server
        DECRYPT takes one integer argument followed by n characters

        DECRYPT n char0 char1 ... charn-1

        where n is the number of characters that will follow after the integer n.
        DECRYPT is to be interpreted as a request by the client to the server to decrypt (decipher) the n characters that will follow the integer n.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • QUIT

        static final int QUIT
        request sent by the client to the server
        QUIT does not have arguments

        QUIT

        QUIT tells the server "bye server, hasta la vista" I'm not going to send you any more requests.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • cmdToString

        default java.lang.String cmdToString(int cmd)
        Converts an integer command cmd to its string representation.

        Supported commands are
        NAME server → client, one int
        ENCODED server → client, one int followed by the charcters
        PLAIN server → client, one int followed by the characters
        DONE server → client, no arguments ENCRYPT client → server, one int followed by the charcters
        DECRYPT client → server, one int followed by the charcters
        QUIT client → server, no arguments

        A command that is not suppored returns the string "UNRECOGNIZABLE COMMAND".
        Parameters:
        cmd - an integer corresponding to a command
        Returns:
        String the textual representation of the command cmd
